member.name: T:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.ILog
member.summary: Simple interface that represent a logger.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.ILog.Log(Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogLevel,System.Func{System.String},System.Exception,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a message the specified log level.
member.param: Optional format parameters for the message generated by the messagefunc.
member.returns: true if the message was logged. Otherwise false.
member.remarks: Note to implementers: the message func should not be called if the loglevel is not enabled so as not to incur performance penalties. To check IsEnabled call Log with only LogLevel and check the return value, no event will be written.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary: Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number. "Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize an instance of the class by initializing the references to the nested and mapped diagnostics context-obtaining functions.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.GetLogger(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the specified named logger.
member.returns: The logger reference.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.OpenNestedContext(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a nested diagnostics context. Not supported in EntLib logging.
member.param: The message to add to the diagnostics context.
member.returns: A disposable that when disposed removes the message from the context.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.OpenMappedContext(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Opens a mapped diagnostics context. Not supported in EntLib logging.
member.param: Determines whether to call the destructor or not.
member.returns: A disposable that when disposed removes the map from the context.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.GetOpenNdcMethod
member.summary: Returns the provider-specific method to open a nested diagnostics context.
member.returns: A provider-specific method to open a nested diagnostics context.

member.name: M:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.GetOpenMdcMethod
member.summary: Returns the provider-specific method to open a mapped diagnostics context.
member.returns: A provider-specific method to open a mapped diagnostics context.

member.name: T:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.OpenNdc
member.summary: Delegate defining the signature of the method opening a nested diagnostics context.
member.param: The message to add to the diagnostics context.
member.returns: A disposable that when disposed removes the message from the context.

member.name: T:Fraunhofer.IPA.MSB.Client.Websocket.Logging.LogProviders.LogProviderBase.OpenMdc
member.summary: Delegate defining the signature of the method opening a mapped diagnostics context.
member.param: Determines whether to call the destructor or not.
member.returns: A disposable that when disposed removes the map from the context.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [provider is available override]. Used in tests.
member.value: true if [provider is available override]; otherwise, false.
